The '''Reformed Christian Church in Slovakia''' has 110 000 members in 205 parishes and 103 mission churches and 59 house fellowships in 10 presbyteries. The bishop is the head of the church, contrast with other [[Reformed]] churches.<ref>http://www.reformata.sk/?page=history</ref>
[[File: Reformed Church in Rozsnyó.jpg|thumb|Reformed Church in Rozsnyó]]
== History == Before the [[World War I]] these congregations was part of the [[Reformed Church in Hungary]]. The Reformation reached this part of the country in 1520s. First Lutheranism, but later [[Calvinism]] dominated. In 1567 four presbyteries was feormed in Eastern Slovakia. In the Synod of Debrecen the [[Second Helvetic Confession]] was adopted. During the counter Reformation the princes of [[Transylvania]] protected the Reformed faith. In this time the princes extended their supremacy to this part of Hungary. After World War II the church adopted their constitution. In 1925 a Theological Seminary was founded in [[Lucenec]]. In 1950s the denomination adopted a constitution.<ref>http://www.reformiert-online.net/adressen/detail.php?id=13265&lg=eng</ref> After the collapse of communism the church adopted a new constitution. The church runs 5 primary schools 2 secondary schools and 1 kindergarten.<ref>http://www.reformata.sk/?page=history</ref>
== Doctrine == *[[Heidelberg Catechism]] *[[Second Helvetic Confession]]
== Demographics == The church had 110,000 members and 204 parishes and 103 congregations and 54 mission churches in 2001 an increase of 25,000 since 1991. Hungarian speaking members are about 95,000-100,000, the church has 225 active pastors, 200 are hugarian speaking.<ref>http://www.oikoumene.org/en/member-churches/reformed-christian-church-in-slovakia</ref><ref>http://www.reformata.sk/?page=history</ref>
There are 9 presbyteries in the denominations, the [[Pozsonyi]], [[Komáromi]], [[Barsi]], [[Gömöri]], [[Abaújtornai]], [[Zempléni]], [[Ungi]], [[Nagymihályi]], [[Ondova-Hernádi]] Presbyteries, and there are several mission congregations,<ref>http://www.reformata.sk/</ref> like the Hungarian Reformed Church in Prague.[http://www.reformata.cz/praga]
== Interchurch relations == Member of the [[World Communion of Reformed Churches]],<ref>[http://www.wcrc.ch/node/164 www.wcrc.ch/node/164]</ref> [[World Council of Churches]]<ref>http://www.oikoumene.org/en/member-churches/europe/slovakia</ref> sister church relations with the [[Reformed Church in Romania]] - Királyhágómelléki District was established.
